item.title: [Blog] Design is an Island
item.author: kevink2019@gmail.com (Kevin Kelly)
item.description: Design is an Island Some of the most impactful learning materials aren’t the works that change the way you think about a problem, but the works that help align your entire mindset to more accurately represent the current level, domain, or in this case, stage of a project. Kent Beck uses the metaphor of islands in a rising sea to describe two different mindsets: refining a design, or pivoting to a new one.

item.description: In Defense of Not-Invented-Here Syndrome Not-Invented-Here Syndrome: just like repeating your code, its always terrible. Except when it isn’t. Like all software ’laws,’ Joel reminds us that everything is context based. Half the reason we learn these rules is so we know when its best to break them. Related Hacker News Discussion (2023)
item.content:encoded:
In Defense of Not-Invented-Here Syndrome

Not-Invented-Here Syndrome: just like repeating your code, its always terrible. Except when it isn’t. Like all software ’laws,’ Joel reminds us that everything is context based. Half the reason we learn these rules is so we know when its best to break them.
